title: Drawing, "Design for a Chaise Lounge", ca. 1810
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on white paper
provenance: Per Registrar files, purchased from B.T. Batsford Ltd., 122 E. 55th St.  It was one of a group of 18 drawings that sold for $31.50 ($35 w/ 10% discount) (Per Wendy Rogers, 1/23/2008)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Jacques Seligmann
description: Elaborate rocaille design for an upholstered chaise lounge, with textile drapery at sides, a vegetal finial at the top, and a book stand with candle holder to one side. A woman is represented in the background. Design derived from a type of cabriolet intended specifically for use in the gardens of German country palaces.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Chaise Lounge", ca. 1810.
ca. 1810. Brush and watercolor, graphite on white paper. Museum purchase through gift of Jacques Seligmann. 1948-24-1.
